title: English (1888) KJV Variorum Reference Study Bible
description:
The **Variorum Reference Bible**, published in 1888, is a notable edition of the King James Version (KJV) that offers readers a comprehensive study tool by incorporating various scholarly insights directly into the biblical text. This edition was meticulously edited by a team of esteemed scholars, including Rev. T.K. Cheyne, M.A., D.D., Rev. S.R. Driver, D.D., Rev. R.L. Clarke, M.A., Alfred Goodwin, M.A., and Rev. W. Sanday, M.A., D.D., LL.D.

The primary feature of the Variorum Reference Bible is its inclusion of **alternative renderings and readings** from authoritative sources. These variations are presented alongside the standard KJV text, allowing readers to compare different interpretations and understandings of specific passages. This approach provides a more nuanced comprehension of the scriptures, highlighting textual differences and the reasons behind them.

In addition to the alternative readings, this edition offers **extensive cross-references** and **marginal notes**. These tools guide readers to related scriptures, facilitating a deeper and more interconnected study experience. The marginal notes often include historical, linguistic, and cultural insights, enriching the reader's engagement with the text.

The Variorum Reference Bible also incorporates the **"Aids to the Student of the Holy Bible,"** a compilation of resources designed to enhance biblical study. This section includes essays, maps, and explanatory articles that provide context and background information, making the scriptures more accessible and understandable.

For many years, this edition was considered one of the most convenient English sources for information on various biblical readings. Its meticulous compilation of scholarly insights made it an invaluable resource for theologians, scholars, and lay readers interested in a deeper exploration of biblical texts.

In summary, the 1888 Variorum Reference Bible stands as a significant scholarly work that enriches the traditional KJV text with a wealth of academic resources, offering readers a multifaceted tool for comprehensive Bible study.
